This flowerpot painting is currently hung in actor Nicholas Cage's home.
He bought it when he visited Pam's art gallery in Austin. She painted
this flowerpot during her time at the Pratt Institute

This drawing was Pam's first sold artwork. Her boss, Michael Scott,
from Dunder Mifflin Inc. (the building portrayed), bought the piece
to hang in their office.

It still hangs there to this day.

This stapler watercolor is a product of Pam's time at Dunder Mifflin. As a
receptionist, she found her mind going to art and painted things around her.

This watercolor shows Pam's growth and how it translates to her later works. This piece
resides in her gallery in Austin.

Pam painted this beautiful piece when she had her first
child, Cecilia. She loves this painting and had it
hanging in her home, until she and her husband had
another child, Philip. She's now has a similar piece
that includes her son. This painting was subsequently
bought by Dwight Schrute, a coworker and friend to the
Halpert family. He said the three birds reminded him
of his time at Dunder Mifflin with Pam and Jim.
